intro: Calysaccion siamense, commonly known as the Siam calysaccion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, often displaying a pale yellow to white color. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits and is also cultivated for ornamental purposes.
